The area benefits from exceptional year-round Mediterranean weather, with over 300 days of sunshine annually. Despite its peaceful, small-town atmosphere, San Fulgencio sits within easy reach of major amenities: Alicante International Airport is approximately 45 minutes away, and larger towns like Torrevieja and Guardamar del Segura are nearby. The region's agricultural traditions blend seamlessly with contemporary development, creating a balanced environment where holiday makers enjoy both tranquility and accessibility. Local markets remain the heart of community life, while modern shopping facilities serve contemporary needs.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in San Fulgencio embodies the relaxed Mediterranean rhythm many seek when purchasing a holiday home. Mornings often begin with coffee at local cafés before beach trips, while afternoons are spent on championship golf courses or exploring hidden coves. The established international community—predominantly British, Northern European, and Scandinavian expats—has created an environment where English is widely spoken, yet Spanish culture remains vibrant. Weekly markets overflow with fresh local produce, seafood, and regional specialties. Dining options range from family-run traditional restaurants serving paella and fresh fish to international cuisine catering to diverse palates. Healthcare is accessible and reliable, with English-speaking doctors and modern private clinics complementing regional hospital facilities. The genuine welcome extended to foreign residents, combined with practical infrastructure and leisure opportunities, makes San Fulgencio an ideal base for extended holidays or seasonal retreats without sacrificing comfort or convenience.
investmentSection: Beyond personal enjoyment, this San Fulgencio bungalow represents a smart investment in one of Spain's most resilient holiday property markets. The area has experienced consistent growth, with prices rising 8% year-on-year, demonstrating strong demand from holiday home buyers and investors. Properties of this specification typically command €800+ weekly rental rates, delivering potential annual returns of €25,000-€30,000 when let through established holiday platforms. San Fulgencio's affordability compared to coastal frontline towns, combined with Blue Flag beach proximity and infrastructure maturity, makes it increasingly attractive to property investors seeking portfolio diversification. The established rental market, international buyer base, and continued economic migration to Costa Blanca suggest sustained appreciation potential.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restriction. EU citizens, UK nationals (post-Brexit), and international buyers all have equal property ownership rights. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), which is straightforward to obtain. Many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, though some require substantial deposits. Legal representation is highly recommended to navigate contracts and tax implications properly.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 6-8% in additional costs. These typically include: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registration fees (0.1%), and legal representation (1-2%). Annual costs after purchase include property tax (0.4-1.1% of property value), community fees (if applicable), and optional private insurance. Our team can provide precise estimates based on your specific purchase situation.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value compared to northern Europe. Groceries, restaurant meals, and utilities are 30-40% cheaper than UK equivalents. A comfortable holiday lifestyle costs €1,200-€1,800 monthly for housing, food, utilities, and leisure activities. Local restaurants serve quality meals for €8-€15 per person. Wine and Spanish products are inexpensive. International goods cost more, but most holiday makers adopt local shopping habits, dramatically reducing expenses. Property ownership costs are predictable and manageable.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche International Airport is approximately 1,000 kilometers south of London. Direct flights typically take 2 hours 15 minutes from major UK airports (London, Manchester, Birmingham). Multiple daily flights operate year-round, with additional summer services. Budget airlines like Ryanair and EasyJet offer competitive pricing, making frequent holiday visits economical. Ferry options via French ports take 24-36 hours, preferred by car travelers. The short flight time makes extended holiday periods practical even with UK-based work or family commitments.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of sunshine annually. Summer temperatures (June-September) range 28-32°C with negligible rainfall, perfect for beach days. Winter months (November-February) remain mild at 12-18°C, occasionally dropping to single digits. Spring and autumn provide ideal conditions: 18-24°C with occasional showers. Holiday periods typically align with sunshine-guaranteed months. The region rarely experiences extreme weather, snow is virtually unknown in lowland areas, and humidity is moderate. Most property owners find the climate supports year-round usage.

faqs.question: Ai-je besoin d'un visa pour acheter un bien en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Property purchase doesn't require special visas. EU and UK citizens can purchase freely under established property rights. You'll need an NIE (Número de Identidad de Extranjero) for tax and legal purposes—easily obtained through the local police national police office. Non-EU citizens have equal purchase rights but may require documentation of financial capacity and legal residence status. Many international buyers hold tourist visas during purchase, then arrange residency separately if desired. Our legal team guides you through all documentation requirements specific to your citizenship.
